entry.title: The Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007 (Transitory Provisions in Consequence of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006) (No. 2) Order 2009
entry.summary: The purpose of this Order is to make transitory provision in consequence of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act (Commencement No. 6, Transitional Provisions and Savings) Order 2009 (S.I. 2009/2611).

entry.title: The Highway Litter Clearance and Cleaning (Transfer of Responsibility) (England) Order 2009
entry.summary: Section 89 of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 places a duty on each local authority to ensure that land comprised in the highways maintainable at the public expense within its area (other than motorways) are so far as is practicable, kept clean and clear of litter and refuse. Section 86(11) empowers the Secretary of State to transfer responsibility for the discharge of these duties as respects all or any part of such a highway from the local authority to the highway authority for that highway.

entry.title: The Companies House Trading Fund (Amendment) Order 2009

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Companies House Trading Fund (Amendment) Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order amends the Companies House Trading Fund Order 1991 (S.I. 1991/1795) by adding to the operations of Companies House funded under that Order its operations as the companies registry for Northern Ireland in accordance with the extension of the Companies Act 2006 to Northern Ireland. The Order adds to the assets and liabilities of the Companies House Trading Fund assets and liabilities attributable to the operations of the companies registry for Northern Ireland. The additional assets are estimated to have a value of £5,000 and the additional liabilities are estimated to have a value of £5,000.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (“the 1999 Regulations”) in respect of the requirements to fit mirrors to certain goods vehicles first used on or after 1st January 2000.

entry.title: The Social Security Benefit (Computation of Earnings) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security Benefit (Computation of Earnings) Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/2745).

entry.title: The School Staffing (England) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the staffing of maintained schools.

entry.title: The Court Martial Appeal Court Rules 2009
entry.summary: These Rules prescribe the practice and procedure to be followed in proceedings of the Court Martial Appeal Court. They replace the existing rules, with amendments following the enactment of the Armed Forces Act 2006 (c. 52) (“the 2006 Act”) and the Criminal Justice and Immigration Act 2008 (c. 4). Both of those Acts make amendments to the Courts-Martial (Appeals) Act 1968 (c. 20). That Act is renamed the Court Martial Appeal Act 1968 by the 2006 Act.

entry.title: The Social Fund Cold Weather Payments (General) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Fund Cold Weather Payments (General) Regulations 1988 (SI 1988/1724) (“the 1988 Regulations”). They modify regulation 3 of the 1988 Regulations and substitute new Schedules in relation to the lists of weather stations and applicable postcode districts in Schedule 1 and alternative weather stations in Schedule 2.

entry.title: The Social Security (Miscellaneous Amendments) (No. 4) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend a number of different regulations relating to social security.

entry.title: The Salaries (Assembly Ombudsman and Commissioner for Complaints) Order (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: This Order provides for an increase in the annual salaries payable to the Assembly Ombudsman for Northern Ireland and the Northern Ireland Commissioner for Complaints.

entry.title: The Pollution Prevention and Control (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Pollution Prevention and Control (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (“the principal Regulations”).

title.div: The Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rating (Electronic Communications) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn y Dreth Gyngor ac Ardrethu Annomestig (Cyfathrebiadau Electronig) (Cymru) 2009

category.term: COUNCIL TAX, WALES;RATING AND VALUATION, WALES
Y DRETH GYNGOR, CYMRU;ARDRETHU A PHRISIO, CYMRU

div.p: This Order amends the Non-Domestic Rating (Collection and Enforcement) (Local Lists) Regulations 1989, the Non-Domestic Rating (Collection and Enforcement) (Central Lists) Regulations 1989 and the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992 in relation to Wales. It provides for the service of certain notices and information by electronic communication on a person who has agreed to accept electronic service.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Ardrethu Annomestig (Casglu a Gorfodi) (Rhestri Lleol) 1989, Rheoliadau Ardrethu Annomestig (Casglu a Gorfodi) (Rhestri Canolog) 1989 a Rheoliadau'r Dreth Gyngor (Gweinyddu a Gorfodi) 1992 o ran Cymru. Mae'n darparu ar gyfer cyflwyno hysbysiadau a gwybodaeth benodol drwy gyfathrebiad electronig ar berson sydd wedi cytuno i dderbyn cyflwyniad electronig.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Regulated Activity, Miscellaneous and Transitional Provisions and Commencement No. 5) Order 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Regulated Activity, Miscellaneous and Transitional Provisions and Commencement No. 5) Order 2009

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order, made under the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (c. 47) (“the Act”), amends the definition of regulated activity in Schedule 4 to the Act and the Regulations which prescribe the criteria on the basis of which a person will be included automatically in the barred lists maintained under section 2 of the Act. It also brings into force amendments to, and the repeal of, provisions in the Police Act 1997 (c. 50) (“the Police Act”) relating to enhanced criminal record certificates and makes transitional provision relating to the issuing of such certificates and to the functions of the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) (which is established under section 1 of the Act).

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (References to Financial Investigators) (Amendment) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (References to Financial Investigators) Order 2009 (“the 2009 Order”) which provides that references to accredited financial investigators in the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (“the Act”), as amended by the Serious Crime Act 2007 are to be read as references to accredited financial investigators within the descriptions specified in the 2009 Order.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Commencement No. 6, Transitional Provisions and Savings) Order 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, NORTHERN IRELAND
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES
CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, NORTHERN IRELAND
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, ENGLAND AND WALES
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND

entry.summary: Article 2 of the Order brings into force section 3 of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the Act”) which has the effect of barring from regulated activity a person who is included in one of the barred lists under section 2 of the Act, namely the children’s barred list and the adults’ barred list. The barred lists are established under section 2 of the Act and are maintained by the Independent Barring Board (“IBB”) which is a body established under section 1 of the Act.

title.div: The Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Commencement No.4 and Consequential, Transitional and Savings Provisions) (Wales) (Amendment No.1) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Deddf Cynllunio a Phrynu Gorfodol 2004 (Cychwyn Rhif 4 a Darpariaethau Canlyniadol a Throsiannol a Darpariaethau Arbed) (Cymru) (Diwygio Rhif 1) 2009

div.p: This Order brings to an end the transitional arrangements made under the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Commencement No.4 and Consequential, Transitional and Savings Provisions) (Wales) Order 2005 (“the No.4 Order”) in relation to The Council of the City and County of Swansea (“the Council”).

Mae'r Gorchymyn yn dod â'r trefniadau trosiannol i ben a wnaed o dan Orchymyn Deddf Cynllunio a Phrynu Gorfodol 2004 (Cychwyn Rhif 4 a Darpariaethau Canlyniadol a Throsiannol a Darpariaethau Arbed) (Cymru) 2005 (“Gorchymyn Rhif 4”) o ran Cyngor Dinas a Sir Abertawe (“y Cyngor”).

entry.title: The Rural Development Contracts (Rural Priorities) (Scotland) Amendment (No. 3) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Rural Development Contracts (Rural Priorities) (Scotland) Regulations2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”) which introduce measures to supplement Council Regulation (EC) No.1698/2005 (O.J. No. L277, 21.10.2005, p.1) (“the Council Regulation”) laying down general rules governing Community support for rural development (financed by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development established by Council Regulation(EC) No.1290/2005 (O.J. No. L209, 11.8.2005, p.1)) and Commission Regulation (EC) Nos.1974/2006 (O.J. No. L368, 23.12.2006, p.15) and 1975/2006 (O.J. No. L368, 23.12.2006, p.74) laying down detailed rules for the application of the Council Regulation.

title.div: The Welsh College of Horticulture (Dissolution) (Amendment) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Coleg Garddwriaeth Cymru (Diddymu) (Diwygio) 2009

div.p: This Order corrects an error in the Welsh text of the Welsh College of Horticulture (Dissolution) Order 2009.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn cywiro gwall yn nhestun Cymraeg Gorchymyn Coleg Garddwriaeth Cymru (Diddymu) 2009.

entry.title: The Environmental Impact Assessment and Natural Habitats (Extraction of Minerals by Marine Dredging) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Environmental Impact Assessment and Natural Habitats (Extraction of Minerals by Marine Dredging) (Scotland) Regulations 2007 (“the principal Regulations”) to the effect that dredging involving the extraction of minerals in harbour areas is caught by the principal regulations (regulation2(2)).

title.div: The National Health Service (Transfer of Residual Estate) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn y Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Trosglwyddo Ystad Weddilliol) (Cymru) 2009

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer of the residual estate from the Welsh Ministers to the National Health Service bodies referred to in the Schedule to this Order from 1 October 2009.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo'r ystad weddilliol oddi ar Weinidogion Cymru i'r cyrff Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol y cyfeirir atynt yn yr Atodlen i'r Gorchymyn hwn o 1 Hydref 2009 ymlaen.
